text: Nice place. I open visit when cycling. The beach is very close.near by there is a public rest room and a free cycle pump. There are two vending machines. One dispenses cycle accessories and the other cool drinks. There is also a big food court that serves a lot of sea food.it better to visit the food place in the evenings.nice place to be with family.I Alo noticed  bus 84 boost stop near by.

Compulsory camps organised by the Ministry of Education. My kid was posted to the East Coast Campus this year under the charge of a tomboy instructor.

I wouldn't advise those whose kids are having mid to serious asthma (ours was not in this range) to even consider going. Having a medical certificate and filling up the pre-camp form was as good as of no use.

The instructor did not allow any pit stop and not forgetting kids are carrying heavy weight backpack or survival pack while hiking. Informed on pre-existing condition.

However, of compliment, is the joining school's boy student in the same team whom displayed excellent teamwork by assisting to encourage and helped "weaker" ones with their backpack, lending of suntan lotion (although had one), etc. Kind soul displayed at a young age!

I was really looking forward to my experience at Outward Bound Singapore (Pulau Ubin Camp 1), but unfortunately, it didnâ€™t live up to my expectations. The facilities felt outdated, and some areas could definitely use better maintenance. Additionally, the scheduling was poorly managed â€” there were long periods of downtime where we just sat around with no clear direction from the staff. While I understand it's an outdoor experience, I believe more organization would have made it much more enjoyable.

The staff, while generally friendly, seemed unprepared for unexpected situations, and there were moments where safety protocols didnâ€™t seem to be adequately enforced, which left me feeling uneasy.

Overall, I hope OBS can work on improving these areas to ensure that future participants have a better experience. I would have appreciated clearer communication and a more structured program.
Did not went for the camp but as I went past this area I saw some wild boars near the area while a camp is ongoing. Please be careful and alert when you go to the camp.

Take one more last look before it makes way for new development.
Thank you for training young selfless leaders to watch over the country continuously.
